snippet: Thomas E. Duncan, the first Ebola patient to develop symptoms in the U.S., is in serious but stable condition.
abstract: Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas initially failed to isolate Thomas E Duncan, traveler from Liberia who showed symptoms of the Ebola virus, and he may have come into contact with 12 to 18 people; Duncan is in critical but stable condition, and the people he came into contact with when he was experiencing active symptoms are being monitored.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and NORIMITSU ONISHI
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Norimitsu Onishi from Monrovia, Liberia. Reporting was contributed by Pamela Kripke from Dallas; Helene Cooper from Monrovia; Viv Bernstein from Kannapolis, N.C.; and Diantha Parker, Marc Santora and Timothy Williams from New York.

lead_paragraph: Thomas E. Duncan, the first Ebola patient to develop symptoms in the U.S., is in serious but stable condition.

headline.main: U.S. Patient Aided Ebola Victim in Liberia
headline.print_headline: Scrutiny in Texas to Detect Whether Ebola Spread

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
